page.title: 11HENLLAN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
The village school opened in 1904. It has five teachers and eighty-five pupils aged between four and eleven. The school is traditional in teaching methods and interior design. In recent years only 20% of new entrants have been able to speak Welsh; upon leaving 50% of each year group have become fluent in Welsh. Playground entertainment consists mainly of variations on the game of 'tip'. It includes:'British Bulldog' 'Polo' and 'Tip around the Circle'. One popular game is 'London', in which a group run towards one child who spells out L-O-N-D-O-N. If anyone is seen moving at the end he goes back to the start.
At the age of 11, pupils leave to attend Denbigh High School or Ysgol Glan Clwyd, St. Asaph.
